title: MS AccessLen()Function

metadata.description: Learn about MS AccessLen()Function with clear explanations and practical examples.

content_sections.title: Details
content_sections.content:
❯
Example
Return the length of a string:
SELECT Len("SQL Tutorial") AS LengthOfString;

Definition and Usage
The Len() function returns the length of a string.
Syntax
Len(
string/varname
)
Parameter Values
Parameter
Description
string/varname
Required. The string or variable name to return the length for
Technical Details
Works in:
From Access 2000
More Examples
Example
Return the length of the text in the "CustomerName" column:
SELECT Len(CustomerName) AS LengthOfString
FROM Customers;

❯
★
+1

content_sections.title: Example
content_sections.code:
SELECT Len(CustomerName) AS LengthOfString
FROM Customers;

summary: This tutorial covers MS AccessLen()Function concepts and techniques. You'll learn how to use MS AccessLen()Function effectively, including key principles, common patterns, and practical examples. By the end of this tutorial, you'll have a solid understanding of MS AccessLen()Function and how to apply it in your projects.
